name: Magic Bullet Mini Juicer with Cup, Black and Silver
about_this_item: A powerful 400-Watt motor extracts all the juicy nutrition from your favorite fruits and veggies.
A roomy 2-inch feed chute fits larger chunks of your favorite ingredients. Translation: less chopping, more juicing.
We keep it tidy with top-rack dishwasher-safe attachments and a silicone spout cap that catches drips before they hit your countertop.
Juice directly into our 16-oz cup, which comes with a twist-on to-go lid for spill-free sipping and portability.
This juicer takes up way less space than standard models, making it a breeze to keep on the countertop or tuck away for later.
NOTE: Refer to User Manual before use
Product built to North American & Canadian Electrical Standards

title: It’s ok
content: I got this specifically to make green juice to get more greens and it doesn’t handle leafy greens well even if you squish them into a ball like the instructions say it just spits a lot of them out without getting a lot of juice. It should say not recommended for leafy greens imo bc it’s not that effective for them is a waste of money to try to juice kale etc.. and not get juice. It works well w other fruits and veggies it’s way easier to clean than other juicers and it’s small so those are the benefits don’t recommend it if you want to use leafy greens though

title: Love it
content: I wanted to try juicing so I ordered this one because its compact in size and relatively inexpensive.  I was amazed at how easy it was to assemble and use.  Also, it was easy to wash and clean the parts after use.  But, I quickly found out that juicing requires a larger than expected amount of fruits and veggies to make a decent cup of juice!  I was going to try celery juice and a full head of celery cut up and juiced didn't even produce a full cup of juice so it would take a LOT of produce to get enough juice - could get expensive for frequent juicing!  So juicing may not be my new hobby but the machine works great!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I like how compact this product is.  It does juice well, but veggies get stuck easily, and at times I don't feel as though it could juice or extract the juice as well as I expect it too.  But using only a few times, I feel it gets the job done!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2024

title: Good machine but juicing not for me...
content: I got this to replace a Jack LaLanne juicer that I gave away several years ago.  The LaLanne was too big and I didn't enjoy getting it out, setting it up, etc.  This unit is small, easy to set up or store, and perfect for a single person or couple.  I have been looking for a juicer that would be efficient, getting all the juice from the pulp, without making a mess/leaking.  So far this hasn't leaked at all.  I tested the pulp with a ham press.  After juicing several oranges, I put the pulp in a ham press and let the spring power compress the pulp for several minutes.  Not a drop of juice came out.  I am hooked.  And clean up was simple.  Pour out the pulp, and run under water.  The shredder basket is, of course, the most difficult - but with the included brush it's still pretty simple.  If you're looking for something small, simple, but that is worth the money?  This is the one you want.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Love it! Remember it’s a “Mini Juicer” so it only makes about 32oz total before it need to be cleaned. If you are the type of person who doesn’t like to clean things this is not for you. You MUST clean this after every use. Works great! Can’t wait to try the next recipe

title: It's a mini juicer
content: As far as juicers go, it’s quieter than our bigger one. I like that it comes with a brush to help clean the juicing blades. The little rubber spout is also easy to clean and detach, and helps with splashes. It also works quite fast  and is powerful and the suction cups on the bottom help stop the juicer from vibrating all over the counter.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Cons: The juice that comes out of the juicer is quite thick and pulpy. There is a visible layer of flesh that sits on top of the juice. The flesh the gets discarded in the bin is also quite heavy with juice, so it feels as though there is quite a bit of waste. I can squeeze quite a bit of juice out of the discarded remains with my hands, so it is not the most efficient juicer in terms of getting all the juice out.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024

title: Good for everything except ginger
content: The product is sleek, compact...it's a mini juicer. Mine did not leak, nor stain when juicing fresh beets, carrots, and other vegetables. From previous juicers I've  owned, I have learned to wash or rinse equipment asap, and to stop leakage...don't force or stuff the shoot....it's a little mini juicer. To me the noise level is low for this type of a juicer and the price. The one issue that I do have....it doesn't extract all of the juice like I would prefer, but they all don't.

title: Great juicer for beginners!
content: Not looking to start a juicing business, but want to make fresh-squeezed juice for your home? Look no further! The Magic Bullet juicer is incredibly easy to assemble and use. I have not noticed a lack in juice extraction- there is definitely pulp left in the machine but it's not loaded with wasted juice, unlike some other juicers I have used in the past. The picture is what I got from about 3/4 of a standard-sized bag full of oranges. All the parts do need to be individually washed after use, so that's why I knocked a star off "easy to clean". Other than that- 5/5 stars!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: What I liked about this juicer.  EVERYTHING!!!  I'm a long time owner of juicers:  Juiceman (really liked, but lid was somewhat tricky to clean , Juice Lady (stainless, but lid abd spout hard to clean, Norwalk (too much work) - and now Magic Bullet - THE BEST!  Love it's compact size.  Wonderful lid, EASY to clean with NO hard to clean narrow crevices.  I give that a PLUS PLUS,PLUS.  Plus the lid hooks to the pulp bin so there is no vibration gap and no leaks.  I also use a plastic bag in that for super easy clean up.  The sieve basket for me is also easy rinse and clean up.  I don't need the handy little brush as my netted wash rag cleans any residue off the blade basket.  And again, the container for the blade basket is really easy clean up.  I was at first concerned it was a 4HP instead of 5, but it is super powerful with no drag when juicing carrots and apples.  And, oh yes, the drip spout.  Totally great idea as it makes cleaning the spout easy and possible, as on my other machines that was mission impossible.  The feeding tube is plenty wide and the handy juice storage cup is actually a nice thought.  Particularly that it has a round bottom to it, again, for EASY cleanup.  I have nothing but good to say about this juicer so far.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023

title: Wow!  Perfect!
content: Love the size of the unit, not as large as other juicers. It's pretty loud but tolerable. Easy to clean after use. My only gripe which is my own fault, is that the juices I get come out very frothy. I didn’t realize that the speed of the rotations plays a factor in the juices that come out. I think I’d prefer a slow speed centrifugal juicer instead. It’s not a big deal and I’ve read there’s ways to minimize the froth like freezing the juice and scooping the froth off the top after it rises, etc. overall, a great product so far.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2024

title: Su utilidad.
content: I own a few Ninja products that worked great for me, so was excited to get this juicer, primarily because it is compact.  However, I was disappointed in this one.  First, there is a defect in design where plastic parts don't fit together all that well when assembled.  As a result, juice sprays from the side of the juicer when in use.  No matter how many times I reassembled it, making sure everything is where it should be, it kept happening.  When I was done juicing my four apples, I realized that the end product was very pulpy.  On the other hand, the collector was empty.  All the remaining pulp pooled at the bottom of the juicing tray, and it was very wet.  It continued to happen after I cleaned out the juicer and tried again.  Overall, I would not recommend this one.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024
